item.description:
Weather permitting: We need good weather for this hike. If forecast for greater than 30% chance of rain for most of the day, we will postpone this great hike for the next available Sunday. Wet boulders create a safety hazard for this +5000ft Mountain hike.

This incredible hike features two beautiful waterfalls, two mighty mountains, a world of fantastic views, and a large A.M.C. hut to rest in! The Ammonoosuc Ravine Trail is the nicest way up to the "rockpile". Stop at Gem Pool to see a wonderful waterfall pour into the emerald pool. A quarter mile more sees two spectacular cascades drop more than 500' into the foot of a gorge!

At only 3.1 miles to the Lakes of the Clouds, the hut & crew welcome hikers to eat, rest, get some shade and spend the night at the foot of Mount Monroe.

It is just .3 of a mile, 20 minutes to summit Mount Monroe (5372') and only 1.5 miles in 90 minutes on Crawford Path, cut in 1819, to summit Mount Washington (6288') from the hut.

Part way up Mt Washington looking back at Monroe, lower lake, & the hut.

This full day round trip is a moderate, yet spectacular 9.0 miles, 3800' of elevation gain in a hiking book time of 6 hours 30 minutes, not including photo ops at the cascades and the 80+ mile 360 degree views on top of both summits.

Remember that it is usually windy up here and colder than the base. Pack for changes in weather. Pack a ski cap, fleece pullover, windbreaker and light gloves even for summer hikes. Gloves are also protective against the rough summit rocks.

Your response/signing up for a hike certifies that you have read, understand, and agree with the NEHAAG disclaimer.

Make sure your hiker profile is complete so we can verify that your qualified to join us on this White Mountain hike.

Let's have a tailgate party after the hike. Pack your icy cooler with what ever you like (remember you still have to drive home). You can't claim a tag until you've finished the hike!
